title: CVPR_1993_10_abs

sentences.text: A model-based approach to on-line cursive handwriting analysis and recognition is presented and evaluated .
In this model , on-line handwriting is considered as a modulation of a simple cycloidal pen motion , described by two coupled oscillations with a constant linear drift along the line of the writing .
By slow modulations of the amplitudes and phase lags of the two oscillators , a general pen trajectory can be efficiently encoded .
These parameters are then quantized into a small number of values without altering the writing intelligibility .
A general procedure for the estimation and quantization of these cycloidal motion parameters for arbitrary handwriting is presented .
The result is a discrete motor control representation of the continuous pen motion , via the quantized levels of the model parameters .
This motor control representation enables successful word spotting and matching of cursive scripts .
Our experiments clearly indicate the potential of this dynamic representation for complete cursive handwriting recognition .

summary: A model-based approach to on-line cursive handwriting analysis and recognition is presented and evaluated . In this model , on-line handwriting is considered as a modulation of a simple cycloidal pen motion , described by two coupled oscillations with a constant linear drift along the line of the writing . By slow modulations of the amplitudes and phase lags of the two oscillators , a general pen trajectory can be efficiently encoded . These parameters are then quantized into a small number of values without altering the writing intelligibility . A general procedure for the estimation and quantization of these cycloidal motion parameters for arbitrary handwriting is presented . The result is a discrete motor control representation of the continuous pen motion , via the quantized levels of the model parameters . This motor control representation enables successful word spotting and matching of cursive scripts . Our experiments clearly indicate the potential of this dynamic representation for complete cursive handwriting recognition .

Predicate-is_considered_as_a_modulation_.label: is considered as a modulation of
Predicate-is_considered_as_a_modulation_.description: This predicate indicates that the subject is viewed or interpreted as an instance or manifestation of the object. In other words, it suggests that the subject exhibits characteristics or patterns similar to those found in the object, and thus can be seen as a modulation or variation of the object's underlying structure or principle.

Predicate-described_by.label: described by
Predicate-described_by.description: The predicate 'described by' indicates that the subject (a phenomenon or process) can be understood, characterized, or explained in terms of the object (a concept, theory, model, or description). It suggests a relationship where the subject's nature, behavior, or underlying mechanisms are captured or represented by the object.

Predicate-is_considered_as_a_modulation_.label: is considered as a modulation of a simple cycloidal pen motion
Predicate-is_considered_as_a_modulation_.description: This predicate describes how the subject (a physical or abstract phenomenon) can be viewed as an expression or manifestation of a simple cycloidal pen motion, where the object represents the underlying pattern or mechanism that generates this modulation. The connection between the subject and object lies in their shared relationship to the cycloidal motion, which serves as a unifying framework for understanding the complex dynamics involved.

Predicate-encode.label: encode
Predicate-encode.description: To transform or represent information into a specific form or code, often involving a process of conversion, compression, or abstraction.

Predicate-estimates.label: estimates
Predicate-estimates.description: The predicate 'estimates' indicates a process of approximation or calculation that yields an expected value or range for the object. It implies a subjective judgment or prediction about the magnitude, extent, or characteristics of the object based on available information and/or analysis.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' indicates an identification or equivalence relationship between its subject and object. It connects the two by stating that they share a common characteristic, property, or nature.

Predicate-enables.label: enables
Predicate-enables.description: The predicate 'enables' indicates that the subject has a facilitating or empowering effect on the object, allowing it to occur, exist, or be achieved. It suggests a causal relationship where the subject provides the necessary conditions for the object to happen.

Predicate-is_used_to_quantify.label: is used to quantify
Predicate-is_used_to_quantify.description: The predicate 'is used to quantify' indicates that the subject (a method, approach, or tool) serves as a means for measuring, evaluating, or assigning numerical values to the object (data, parameters, etc.), often in order to facilitate analysis, comparison, or decision-making.

Predicate-is_presented_as.label: is presented as
Predicate-is_presented_as.description: The predicate 'is presented as' indicates a relationship between two abstract representations of an idea or concept. The subject represents one way to express this idea, while the object presents another equivalent representation. This predicate suggests that both expressions convey the same meaning and essence, despite potentially differing in form or detail.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: Indicates that the subject concept is more specific than or equivalent to the object concept. The predicate establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two concepts, where the subject is a narrower term and the object is a broader term.
